New Records: Rohit Sharma scored the fastest century by an India player at a Cricket World Cup in 63 balls, breaking a 40-year-old record set by Kapil Dev.
Rohit has gone clear of compatriot Sachin Tendulkar with seven Cricket World Cup centuries.
Rohit joined a fellow tearaway opener in David Warner as the joint-fastest batters to reach 1000 Cricket World Cup runs, doing so in just 19 innings.
Rohit is the only Cricket World Cup 2023 captain to score a century to this point of the tournament.
Making his 31st ODI hundred, Rohit overtook Ricky Ponting in third place in the total ODI century list.
India skipper Rohit Sharma became the batter with most international sixes across all formats.
Key Match Events: Rohit blazed 131 in just 84 balls as his team sauntered past Afghanistan's 272, eventually winning with 90 balls to spare.
Virat Kohli (55*) and Shreyas Iyer (25*) finished the chase, earlier set up by the opening partnership of Rohit and Ishan Kishan (47), who put on 156 in 18.4 overs.
Rashid Khan (2/57 off eight overs) was the only bowler to make any headway for Afghanistan, with four of his teammates going for eight an over or more.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit claimed unanimous Player of the Match honours, as India joined New Zealand and Pakistan as teams to start two from two at the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: But it will be tough going to reach Tendulkar's record for the most runs at Cricket World Cups of 2278 at an average 56.95, though Rohit boasts a superior average of 65.23 which is also the highest among players to reach four figures across the tournaments.
